title: Space Force challenged to define commercial services

title: Shipping giant Maersk to add SpaceX’s Starlink internet to over 330 ships by early next year
summary: Danish logistics giant Maersk is adding SpaceX’s Starlink to more than 330 container ships, the companies announced on Thursday.

title: Investing in Space: A reality check on SPAC frenzy revenue projections
summary: We’re now at least two years on from when a slew of space companies went public during the SPAC frenzy, and, look, none of them look great.

title: Startup GuardianSat gets research grant for satellite self-defense technology
summary: GuardianSat won a grant from the National Science Foundation’s America’s Seed Fund to advance the company’s technology designed to protect satellites from collisions with debris objects in space.

title: SpaceX Starlink lands Maersk in new deal for Ocean fleet
summary: SpaceX’s Starlink satellite internet service has landed a new client in Maersk, as the two companies came to terms on a deal...

title: Oops—It looks like the Ariane 6 rocket may not offer Europe any launch savings
summary: Europe is subsidizing the launch of Internet satellites for Jeff Bezos.

title: Avio Target Up To 6 Vega C Flights in 2025
summary:
Italian rocket maker Avio has shared that it expects to launch between four and six Vega C flights in 2025. The projection was revealed as part of a presentation shared during Italian Excellences 2023, an event that features around 50 companies listed on the Euronext STAR Milan segment of the Italian Stock Exchange. Vega C […]
The post Avio Target Up To 6 Vega C Flights in 2025 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Viasat has enough throughput on ViaSat-3 Americas to avoid replacement
summary: Viasat has ruled out ordering a ViaSat-3 Americas replacement as it expects to recover a fraction of the satellite’s 1 terabit per second capacity, the operator said Oct. 12 around three months after disclosing its antenna issue.

title: Viasat won’t replace damaged Americas satellite, moves up financial targets
summary: Viasat shares rose on Thursday after the company said it expects to meet financial growth targets earlier than expected and that it won’t need to replace a damaged $750 million communications satellite.
